Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha0017
Reviews.Content: Hotel room and toilet size is excellent for European Standards. Very modern interior. Big flat screen Tv but only the news is in English. Rest of the TV channels were all in Italian which was very disappointing considering the hotel is rated 4 star. Few Restaurants close by and the top of the Spanish steps are a good 10 minutes walk. The walk to the Spanish steps can be a lonely walk as the surrounding area is dark and deserted. Air conditioning did not work very well in our room. Staff at the hotel are great! very friendly and helpful! Free Wi Fi in rooms which was very convenient! Overall was satisfied with this hotel. If you are looking for a hotel very close to the Spanish steps-book the intercontinental which is only a 2 minutes walk. This hotel is a good location if your main focus is Shopping in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Berg Luxury Hotel good Terravision Buses bad”
Reviews.Author: Theossies
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely Hotel spread over seven floors in a quiet residential area. The staff are pleasant and helpful and will gladly do there best to advise you on restaurants, metro, buses etc. We were on the seventh floor and the room was bright and airy with a modern minimalist feel to it. The bathroom had two wash basins and a large walk in shower. There is a trick to operating the shower and as the room lacks any printed information of any kind insist on a demo even if the porter gets wet doing it. The breakfast was good as mainland Europe tastes go. Plenty of fresh fruit, rolls, cereals and great coffee. The breakfast waiter was a lovely guy who made an effort. From the Hotel the Spagna and Barberini metros are a ten minute walk. We used them to get to the Colosseum and the Vatican city. An all day ticket for the metros and the city buses costs only four euro. There is also a lovely park near by which is worth a stroll if you have a little time left before you leave and is five minutes away. BEWARE of Terravision buses however.. Do not use this Airport bus company when in Rome unless you are prepared to fight you way on to their buses. We found them outside Fiumicino Airport on a Thursday night and had a pleasant journey into the main city centre train station. As it was late and there were few passengers looking for transport that part of the journey was a good experience. As it was such good value we bought a return journey for the following Sunday afternoon and arrived in plenty of time for the half past four bus. We did not know and there were no signs to tell us that we needed to convert our return tickets into boarding passes. A boarding pass would have been a good idea if Terravision issued the same number of passes as there were seats on the next bus. They issued passes to anyone who wanted them and a rough and unsupervised scrum took place as the next bus to leave opened its doors. As we had no passes we took a taxi and saw at least ten deserted passengers left behind as the bus pulled out. Given the lengthy time needed to go through airport security in Fiumicino these poor souls could easily have found themselves missing their flights.

Reviews.Title: “Rome March 2012 - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanda m
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome for 4 days 3 nights and booked this hotel ...,was great from the welcome we received through to the arranged private car return to the airport ( same price as Taxi ) ... The room was great, large and quite with a fantastic bathroom. The location was fantastic - 5 mins walk to Spanish steps , just around the corner from Via Veneto with lots of little cafes and some nice shops all within easy reach..... we didnt eat breakfast any day as we were up and out early ( normally 7am) to get ahead of the crowds but there are plenty of places close by when walking towards your sight seeing for that day !! Massimo and Marco were very helpful in all questions .... The hotel had a great VIBE to it - very relaxed and hip ..... lets say i wouldn't ask my parents to stay here but if you like small designer hotels this is a great spot to stay .....

Reviews.Title: “Haven!”
Reviews.Author: YowSusan
Reviews.Content: Our time in Rome was exceptional due in large part to this outstanding hotel. Our room was spacious with a comfy bed, pillows and an awesome shower. The staff was really friendly and helpful with directions. Shout out to Marco and Mehdi. Great location on a short quiet street, walking distance to many sights, including the must see Villa Borghese. I hope we will be their guests again, it was a delightful place to recharge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: loukkcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights this weekend in the snow. It is a beautiful hotel. Our room was huge, the bed gorgeous and huge, and a fabulous bathroom. The shower is amazing as lots of people have said. The decor is really cool and modern too throughout the hotel. The one thing the hotel doesn't have, which is why I only have it 4 stars, is any sort of atmosphere at all. You almost feel like you have to whisper in reception. The staff are extremely polite, but there's no warmth and the bar is dead. The hotel room is fab though, but I do think it is very pricey for what you get. But then, that's Rome!!! Location is good too, although it was extra snowy there because it's on a hill. That just made it extra pretty though!! Breakfast is basic, but good. It's great that they stay serving it til 11 though.

Reviews.Title: “Didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: sandy h
Reviews.Content: My sister had stayed in Berg 2 weeks before we went.So glad she did! Beautiful hotel and Massimo and rest off staff were so helpful i.e booking taxis waking us up for a trip as i forgot to change time on my phone. Our room is one off the nicest we have ever stayed in.Toilet was amazing as shower room was huge. Hotel is close to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain,Plenty Bars and Restaurants near the hotel just what you need after lots off walking,Hotel has cosy bar. We cant praise this Hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel near the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Jo B
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a fabulous trip to Rome, One of the highlights was the hotel. Beautiful, stylish and chic, with extremely friendly staff. They gave us a recommendation for a local restaurant for my boyfriends birthday which couldn't have been better. The shower was huge with stunning lighting, beds very comfortable.. Breakfasts are delicious. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: P_and_P_Adventures
Reviews.Content: My wife found this place and I'm glad she did. This hotel was fantastic. We stayed here for 5 nights. The building, rooms, and amenities are all modern and stylish. My wife particularly loved the shower. It's so big you can throw a party in it (just kidding). It was huge though and a rain/jacuzzi shower. The staff was super friendly, helpful and remembers and greets you by name. The breakfast didn't come with our room, it costs about 18 Euros, but had a reasonable assortment of food and great service. Their selection changed slightly day to day to give it some variety. The location of the hotel was also good in my opinion. The walk to the Colosseum was about 20 minutes. It's not too far and you get to walk through all of historic Rome and shops. The Spanish steps is only like 5 minutes from this place. Overall, the value you get with the Berg Luxury Hotel is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hightech in the heart of ancient Rome”
Reviews.Author: olga_and_vadim
Reviews.Content: We did not expect to be so happy with the hotel which is labeled as hitech by many revierws. But in fact it was our charming discovery for the last visit in Rome during X-mas holidays. We were welcomed on reception and given all necessary guidance during our staying. We were charmed by stylish design, hospitality and well combination of simplicity and comfort. Next time in Rome, our preferences are clear - we will stay in Berg

Reviews.Title: “Far from Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Simon R
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked too good to be true and it was. When we arrived they did not have our reservation and did not seem concerned - just registered us and showed us to our room. The room at first seemed nice enough but the air conditioning wasn't working so room was too hot and had to have window open which was noisy. As part of our booking we were expecting a bottle of sparkling wine and fruit basket this wasn't there and after asking three times we were given a bottle of cheep red wine and a plate of over ripe prepared fruit which was obviously left over from the breakfast buffet. The shower had only luke warm water for first 2 days and cold water on last day of our trip which was to say the least annoying - when we complained the concierge laughed and told us work was being done. Breakfast was buffet style with a miserable selection of cheese and meat which appeared to be same day after day and stale bread for toast. Not very appetisiing at all. The hotel seemed unfinished in parts. The bar was tiny and uninviting and the drinks prices outrageous. The only good point really was the location which was close to metro and walking distance to many sights. Considering this was meant to be 4* luxury I was unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun room, needs coffee”
Reviews.Author: BDWarr
Reviews.Content: Other reviews cover it well, especially agree with CMc63 below. Nice, modern room, great location, helpful staff, reasonable rates. I must, however, second the comment that the lack of in-room coffee is a minor but annoying gap for a place that has "luxury" in the name. I tried to get just a few cups of coffee to bring up to the room in the morning and was told I would have to order the entire 20 euro per person breakfast to get the coffee. My room reservation did not include breakfast. I went across the street and got two Americanos to go, but they were small and, what can I say, I'm American, I like my big Starbucks drip coffee in the morning. In-room coffee/tea service is standard in so many hotels now that it just seems like a silly thing to leave out.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service ruins an interesting design.”
Reviews.Author: Nomadicluxury
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a nicely designed boutique hotel in Room and after a long search I found the Hotel Berg and decided to try it out. The location of the hotel is fantastic. The design is nice as well. The room was kept very clean and everything in the room worked as it should have. Wifi was free and fast. The bed was comfortable as well. I stayed in the deluxe room which was just the right size. The desk was comfortable to work at and the TV had many channels. The only problems I had with the room were that there was no fan in the bathroom and after you had a shower the bathroom would stay wet for a long time and there was no bottled water in the room ever, and in fact the glasses in the bathroom were simply cheap plastic throw-away cups that were so fragile they would actually break apart when you tried to get the plastic wrapping off them. I have never seen that in a room that cost 350 Euros before. For me though the big disappointment was the service. There were 3 staff that I met while there, one young man was an incredibly aloof Filippino who seemed to not have any idea what quality customer service meant and then there was an older Italian gentleman who was very nice but never seemed to get anything right that you requested from him and then there was the young Italian in charge of the front desk overnight who would constantly try and sell you some kind of car service every time you came back to the hotel if he was not asleep in the hotel lobby lounge chair. It was a very un-comfortable situation. If the service had of been good I would recommend this hotel but the way it is now I would not recommend it to anyone. For anyone who is interested in staying a very nice boutique hotel with excellent service I have to recommend the Hotel Babuino 181, I stayed there a week after the Hotel Berg and it was everything I expected in a hotel. Great location, excellent service and very well designed rooms. It was only slightly more than Hotel Berg but worth every Euro.

Reviews.Title: “Just OKAY - rather a 3 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartyNewYork
Reviews.Content: First the Pros: Location is great and quiet, Hotel is new which is a nice change in Rome. Bathrooms are great, especially the shower. Rooms are well cleaned. Wifi works well and no extra charge. BUT: Dull and boring interior. For the price they charge and what they want to be, very basic furniture -all brown and depressing. No flowers, no fresh fruit, no colour. Room is too hot even in October and A/C doesn't work properly. Service is inefficient. Breakfast and selection is at most okay, service unacceptable (I wasn't even noticed that I was there and left without being served coffee, etc. - there were only 7 people in the room!). All in all, okay for 100-150 EUR per night but not for 300 EUR and above.

Reviews.Title: “NICE, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: Reyniers
Reviews.Content: I've just been back from this hotel. Staff is real nice and they go al the way but... we had a suite (602) which had even 3 TV's which we didn't need (more Russian channels than English) but there were no coffee facilities in the room. Yes, I like my morning coffee when the misses has a shower (takes a time :-) At night you could ask the reception for a (free) coffee which they bring within a second which is very nice but in the morning I like my privacy. Location is great. Room was very nice. Shower was fantastic Airco isn't working correctly and even in October the room was very hot so we set the temperature at 17° C and still this was to hot. So, beware if you are going in summer! If you open a window you are lucky that the restaurant downstairs hasn't have a singing waiter at 11.30 p.m which we had in October. This hotel is brand new so I wonder why the owner hasn't visited other hotels to have all the major issues sorted out. I wonder how this hotel will rate in a few years;

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise with this brandnew boutique hotel close to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: Pavol M
Reviews.Content: Berg Luxury Hotel was a nice surprise while staying in Rome. I didn't know this boutique hotel before as it is brandnew property opening its doors just in May 2011 and it all feels like new - in positive and negative way. The positive side is very nice, elegant, modern, glamour styled interior and decor. The negative side - it still expects construction of some facilities (fittness and business corner reportedly coming soon) and new jacuzzi was not yet working although already installed at suite terrace. The hotel has excellent location, in quiet street just few minutes walking to Spagna Steps, Fontana di Trevi or Via Vittorio Veneto and sitting just stone throw of Villa Borghese gardens. The nearest metro station (Barberini or Spagna) will require also cca 5-8 min walking. Do not take taxi from Termini Station when arriving to the hotel as they will charge you cca 20 eur for a very short ride (and they initially asked even 30 eur). We have booked Junior Suite Cool at highest floor because of its large terrace and interior (be aware the other Junior Suite Trend is not having terrace). Surprisingly, we have received upgrade upon check-in to the next door's Audrey Suite (mentioned also as Presidential Suite) which had even larger terrace overlooking roofs of Rome and Swiss Institute (a beautiful villa and garden opposite the hotel). The size of suite is nice - room itself cca 60 sqm, the terrace with relaxing and dining sitting and jacuzzi of the size of cca 60 sqm and large bathroom with lighting shower, design bath and nice picture of Audrey Hepburn. We have learned later there are more suites available (cca 50-60 sqm each), but the only rooms with terrace are Junior Suite Cool and Audrey Suite. Wifi worked fine in the room, however breakfast would require some improvement - the breakfast room is quite small which itself is not a big issue, but some food stuff runs quickly and is slowly replenished. As selection is not wide - although of very good quality - you have to ask waiter to be delivered with some more eggs, ham etc. The staff is very friendly and helpfull, we had no communication issue and has been provided with answers or recommendations which proved to be right. The hotel is excellent gateway for romantic couples wishing to explore Rome and to be close to almost everywhere in the city centre. A bit higher price is paying off especially for recommended rooms with terrace and breathtaking views of Rome (Junior Suite Cool and Audrey Suite). Overall - we would rate close to 5, but still some mentioned negatives will allow us to rate at 4.5 out of 5. Definitely coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ZiZ77
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and cooperative Staff! Nice and Tidy rooms, All newly furnished! All equipped with WiFi Internet access. Perfect Location, Calm and tidy area for some good rest after a busy day! Few minutes away from the major attractions and connections! Will definitely be there again if back in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: KeeshoneKenya
Reviews.Content: Good location, on a quiet street. All modern and well decorated room with nice picture of Audrey Hepburn. Excellent service and friendly staff. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Well located designer/boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMc63
Reviews.Content: Location: lovely area above above the Spanish Steps & near the Borghese Park (if struggling to locate Via Aurora, its near the US Embassy). Its on a fairly quiet side street so a good night's sleep can be had even if like us, you sleep with the windows open - all we could hear was the fountain in nearby park/garden. Having said that, it is within easy walking distance of all the main sites - we chose to walk everywhere but could just as easily have caught a tram. Rooms: I think we had a 'superior' room, which was reasonably spacious (approx. 20 sq m) and beautifully designed (timber floor/leather bed/planed veneer wall panels/designer lighting etc). it was very clean with good quality bedding and large shower room that was kitted out with nice finishes + sanitary ware. Hotel: Again beautifully designed and very clean. I think different people have different expections of a 4* hotel. I was only staying for 3-nights and was looking for clean, comfortable, unassuming, so the Berg met my expectations. However, this is a very small hotel and I suspect that it might not suit all travellors, especially if staying for longer or travelling with children becuase the level of service, although pleasant, was quite understated and the bar is little more than a cupboard - fine for most travellers who are probably happy to go out and experience rome, but when we used to travel with our children, i preferred a hotel with a bar/restaurant so that i had the option of having a drink on the premises if desired. Food: We didn't try the room service. The breakfast wasn't especially memorable but was fresh and reasonably varied and although things were topped up, they were not topped up as efficiently as they might have been, particularly the eggs and we were only offered one coffee each, which we thought a bit mean though presumably we could have requested more. Note: there are two or three restaurants on the same street as the hotel. we had a very good meal (though not the cheapest meal we had in Rome) at the Roman Cucina next door but one. the one directly next to the hotel also looked pleasant and was also quite cheap but as taxi loads of italians seem to flock to the roman cucina, we decided on that one. The Berg is a clean, comfortable, attractively designed hotel in a lovely area and on the whole, we were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Gary O
Reviews.Content: In a side-street in the Via Veneto area, this is a boutique hotel with a cosy feel. We stayed in a small suite, with lovely decor, very modern. The only issue we had with it was with the shower and that was fixed the next day. The breakfast room is small but big enough for the clientele. The bar is *very* small, but this is Rome - what are you doing staying the hotel bar? The area is top-notch and therefore very pricey. But its an easy walk to the Spanish Steps and beyond where the eateries are slightly less prenetious. Friendly and helpful staff. We loved the place and will go back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience and we will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Agata A
Reviews.Content: Great experience for a very reasonable price! Brand new hotel in a heart of Rome but still in a very quiet street, which enables a good rest after long hours of sightseeing. Each of the rooms has a different movie theme and rooms are very clean. At first we've stayed in a suite for couple of nights which was beyond our expectations. Specious room divided into two parts, with a huge bathroom, separate closet and a view of the park. Food in the hotel was very good (simple Italian breakfast, excellent room service!), but the dining room is pretty small. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Front desk employees helped us to plan transportation for the rest of the trip. We loved it so much that after one week of traveling down the south we came back for the last night before our flight back home. This time we stayed in a double standard room (Audrey Hepburn style) which was also very specious with huge bathroom. The view was a little worse ;-). We recommended this hotel to everybody and we will stay there when next time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: DimskiDimsum
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early from an overnight flight from Thailand but were nevertheless able to check in right away, get breakfast and were not charged for it! There were a few glitches with getting the lights and airconditioning to work but ultimately this was solved by the flipping of a switch hidden behind the mirror hanging on the wall! The beds were huge and very comfortable and the bathrooms were magnificent with a big rain shower. No bath. No balconies but the windows open onto a quiet street. We only had one day and night in Rome so, location-wise, the hotel was ideal. Easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi fountain. The concierge was also very helpful and provided us with a map. Breakfast in the tiny dining room is pretty basic but filling. Aside from wireless internet there are no other facilities (pool, gym etc.) All in all perfect for a short stay, any longer than 2 nights and I'd say probably not!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: 16stef
Reviews.Content: lovely, modern, comfortable, artsy room. great bed and duvet. artistic decoration. Very complete breakfast with reasonable hours. excellent location for an easy and very pleasant walk to Borghese park and Via Veneto. very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny & new”
Reviews.Author: Lilybuddah
Reviews.Content: Caught a shuttle bus from airport for the 2 of us for 30euro which dropped us off right outside the hotel. Nice quiet location. Room was clean, buffet breakfast was filling, WI-FI was great for my iPhone & Marco & Massimo at reception were helpful. The only drawback was our fridge didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: pcs325
Reviews.Content: Found it on agoda as always you don't. Know if the hotel really is 'luxury' till you experience it. Despite having an inaccurate map and carrying suitcases up Spanish steps and stone hills at 10pm lost as anything,,, I got top floor (level 7) and when we opened the door experienced that wow factor!! After getting my bearings after breakfast.. Which was light and enjoyable, I decided to use the Internet to check out Rome. The Internet sapped was very fast and worked everywhere in the hotel! Best Internet service ever found.Short walk down the hill again and long and behold the Spanish steps, which as a tourist in Rome will be an ideal landmark to meet friends or catch Metro! I found the staff to be great, even offered to iron our suitcase crushed clothes (there is no facility in room). THERE IS RESTAURANT NEXT DOOR THAT LOOKS GREAT, FOOD QUITE NICE... BUT LET ME WARN YOU THE PRICESMLOOK CHEAP BUT EXPECT AT LEAST 8 euro added to the bill at the end. I know cover charge is apparent in Europe at some restaurants = 1 euro each person but a hidden 5 euro 'service charge' per table will leave you arguing with surprise? 3 tables of tourists argued while we were eating. Overall loved it and even my Italian friends want to stay as they said the price is good for the quality and location, hope you enjoy also!

Reviews.Title: “Shiny New Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lainey86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a long week-end with my boyfriend and loved it. The staff were very helpful. Before we arrived we emailed to ask if we could check in at 9am, due to a very early flight and got a response saying a room would be made available within minutes. We did ask reception for restaurant recommendation twice, once for lunch and once on a Sunday evening. Both times the places were closed so I would keep in mind the need for a guide book! It's very much as expected, very dark, sleek, modern hotel. The room's are the perfect size (we stayed in the Deluxe) and the bathroom was almost the same size as the room! Amazing shower and great cosmetics. Free wi-fi which was very helpful. The breakfast room was small but the hotel has very few rooms. It is typical European breakfasts - pastries, coffee, juice, yogurt, fruit and cereal. I did notice one morning that there was a queue for a table, it dispersed after 5 minutes or so though. They do have a bar, I just went in - didn't have a drink there. It's extremely small, 5 people or so I wouldn't rely on it but the location is great - 5-10 minutes’ walk from lots of great places. The street, whilst central is very quiet. The one negative is that I booked through Voyage Prive and in hindsight I do feel we over paid for what we got. Obviously this was bad judgement/lack of shopping around on my part and not the hotels. This is an ideal spot for a nice break with your other half/friends. I would definitely use it again for a girls week-end.

Reviews.Title: “excelent choice”
Reviews.Author: nyorker3331
Reviews.Content: initially i was a bit worried to stay in a new hotel with not too many reviews !!! i this was an amazing experience from the moment we stepped in until the moment we left. beautiful hotel in a great location close to all the major sites but quite and away from the crowds. breakfast was served to our room daily- Delicious... great way to start our day.... very romantic clean room all new hip and well working wi fi internet... u can not go wrong with this one. marco in the front desk was great... very nice guy ... he was very helpful with lots of info and overview to share. him and david from the night shift made our stay even sweeter. thank u!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: Mariaelena76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, wonderfully placed in the Via Veneto area where you can reach Trinità dei Monti in 10/15 minutes walking. Villa Borghese is at 2 minutes as well as Piazza Barberini. Rooms are huge (and it was a standard room) and perfectly decorated with design accessories. Berg opened in May this year so everything is brand new. People at the reception desk are nice and helping, breakfast can be improved for a 4stars superior but waiters are caring and trying to help to satisfy your needs. We were there for a romantic journey, the area is quite and relaxing. This hotel is a real top spot! Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Haifa_B
Reviews.Content: The Berg luxury hotel is a new hotel in a great location just 5 minutes walk to the Spanish Steps, tucked away nicely in a trendy area. Its a beautiful 4 star hotel that puts some of the top named hotels to shame!! The rooms stylish, spacious with comfortable beds, great bathroom and powerful shower. Marco and Massimo the hotel staff were so friendly and helpful!! At the time of my booking there were no reviews, so I was a bit hesitant as it was s new hotel but I booked it anyway through Klebster, and am so glad I did. It was the perfect choice, like I said in a great location and I enjoyed the stay thoroughly. Would definitely stay at the berg again!!! Thanks for making my stay a lovely experience. Haifa
